articles.title: Japan's Moves to Infringe upon Sovereignty of Tok Islet Denounced
articles.content:
Japan's Moves to Infringe upon Sovereignty of Tok Islet Denounced 
    Pyongyang, April 1 (KCNA) -- The "Council of Religious Leaders" of south Korea held a meeting on Tok Islet on Mar. 26 at which it branded Japan's claim to the islet as a blatant provocative act of infringing upon the territorial integrity of Korea and its national sovereignty, according to south Korean MBC.
 The organization held that this situation is attributable to Japan's distortion of history and moves to revive militarism, strongly demanding the government's strong retaliation against them and an apology from Tokyo.

articles.title: U.S. Cold War-Minded Political Mode Assailed
articles.content:
U.S. Cold War-Minded Political Mode Assailed 
    Pyongyang, April 1 (KCNA) -- Peru's well known news commentator Juan Mariategui wrote a book "Review of International Politics". Under the first title "Peace Talks. Cold War Persists on the Korean Peninsula" of the Asian Part of the Fifth Charter of the book, he referred to the fact that the Korean Peninsula was divided by the U.S. imperialists' occupation of south Korea in 1945 and the Korean war broke out in 1950. In the book he also dealt with the atrocities perpetrated by the U.S. imperialists against south Koreans and the arrogant behaviour of the U.S. blaming the nuclear activities of the DPRK while conniving at the production of nuclear weapons
by other countries.
 He continued: The U.S. is persistently applying the political mode dating back to the Cold War era to the Korean Peninsula even today when the world structure of the Cold War was destroyed to open a U.S. unipolar era. The U.S. imperialists staged an aggressive joint military exercise with south Korea every year. They have rearmed Japan and egged it on to pursue a hostile policy towards north Korea.    
 Various attempts were made by the north and the south in the past to achieve Korea's reunification. However, they proved futile due to the interference by the U.S. and Japan. The issue of the Korean Peninsula should be settled through dialogue free from foreign interference under any circumstances.    
 President Kim Il Sung provided a number of meetings and talks for the country's reunification between the north and the south in the wake of the joint conference of representatives of political parties and public organizations in north and south Korea held in April 1948. Then he put forward the proposal for founding the Democratic Federal Republic of Koryo, the 10-Point Programme of the Great Unity of the Whole Nation for the Reunification of the Country and so on to indicate ways of achieving the
country's reunification. The reunification of the Korean Peninsula should be achieved peacefully, not by a war, pursuant to this policy and the Korean Armistice Agreement should be replaced by a peace agreement.

Day of Sun to Be Commemorated in Kyrgyzstan
articles.content:
Day of Sun to Be Commemorated in Kyrgyzstan
    Pyongyang, April 1 (KCNA) -- A preparatory committee of the United Confederation of Koreans in Kyrgyzstan to commemorate the Day of the Sun was formed in Bishkek on Mar. 28.
 The inaugural meeting of the preparatory committee elected its chairman, vice-chairman and members.    
 The preparatory committee decided to hold colorful functions including a show of films on the life and revolutionary activities of President Kim Il Sung, a meeting, performances of "Arirang" and "Toraji" art troupes under the United Confederation of Koreans and an evening gala.

Gift to Kim Jong Il
articles.content:
Gift to Kim Jong Il
    Pyongyang, April 1 (KCNA) -- Leader Kim Jong Il was presented with a gift by the friendship delegation of the Communist Party of China on a visit to the DPRK.
 The gift was today handed to Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, by Ma Wen, deputy secretary of the Central Commission for Discipline Inspection of the CPC who is heading the delegation.
